Class MapCanvas

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget
      • org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Control

              • bui.MapCanvas
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.EventListener, org.eclipse.swt.events.MouseListener, org.eclipse.swt.events.MouseMoveListener, org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Drawable, org.eclipse.swt.internal.SWTEventListener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    MiniMapCanvas

    public class MapCanvas
extends org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Canvas
implements org.eclipse.swt.events.MouseListener, org.eclipse.swt.events.MouseMoveListener
    Creates a drawable canvas by subclassing SWT.canvas and drawing the images provided through the Img and ImgSet classes as a game map on the canvas.
    See Also:
    GameMap

      • MapCanvas

        public MapCanvas(org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Shell sh,
         GameMap map,
         ImageSet imgs)
        constructor calls the parent super constructor, sets up private attributes and then calls the onLoad function to initialize the game map.

        Note: probably does not do a very good check of the proper terrain map being loaded Important: any thing calling this constructor must be a subclass and override drawViewport or the whole thing probably crashes

        Parameters:
        sh - SWT.Shell
        map -
        imgs -

    • Method Detail

      • isoTfn

        protected org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Rectangle isoTfn(org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Rectangle rec,
                                        int x_scale_factor,
                                        int y_scale_factor,
                                        boolean fwd_rev)
        Isometric Transform: uses the width and height parameters of an SWT.Rectangle and extracts a corresponding integer pair that should correlate to the coordinates of a given Tile in the overall GameMap.

        Depends on Img.x_ and y_adj which should be passed in as x_ and y_scale_factor

        Historical notes: the original, empirically determined formulas were:

        tmp_x = (x*Img.x_adj) - (y*Img.x_adj) + x_ori + x_offset;

        tmp_y = (x*Img.y_adj) + (y*Img.y_adj) + y_ori + y_offset;

        These refactored as:

        (x-y) *x_adj * sign + (x_ori + x_offset),

        (x+y) *y_adj * sign + (y_ori + y_offset)

        where the sign was +1 for laying out tiles and -1 for finding the coordinates of a tile. isoTFN does not add the _ori or _offset factors, this must be done separately if desired.

        There were easily made errors when replicating the formula in different places in the code. So, the function setup is more complex but probably more reliable for long term use.

        Parameters:
        rec - SWT.Retangle, only the width and height are used
        x_scale_factor - should be Img.x_adj
        y_scale_factor - should be Img.y_adj
        fwd_rev - should be true to paint tiles and false to find tiles equivalent to multiplying by plus or minus one respectively
        Returns:
        Rectangle only the width and height will be changed

      • viewPortDraw

        public void viewPortDraw(org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Event event)
        Build the map on a Canvas: probably should be named DrawCanvas, does not really define a viewport. Function actually draws the entire map regardless of visibility in the shell/canvas.

        Parameters:
        event -

      • keyPressed

        private void keyPressed(org.eclipse.swt.events.KeyEvent ke)
        Keyboard movement commands: Controls the movement of the MapCanvas in response to the aswd and arrow keys translates both x and y axes to give pseudo planar movement at an angle.

        Checks for bounds of the map by evaluating the size of the GameMap Tile[][] array dimensions ( 0 <= x < x_game, 0 <= y < y_game).

        Parameters:
        ke - is a KeyEvent from the addKeyListener -> KeyAdapter constructor

      • mouseDoubleClick

        public void mouseDoubleClick(org.eclipse.swt.events.MouseEvent e)
        Double click on the full size map changes the active tile, but not<\b> the x_, y_ori pair.

        This behavior is different than the double click on the full size map. Double click on MiniMap changes the active Tile and also<\b> x_ and y_ori for the full size MapCanvas. <\p>

        Specified by:
        mouseDoubleClick in interface org.eclipse.swt.events.MouseListener
        Parameters:
        e - MouseEvent
